comment.author: 25681217@N04
comment._content: The netting atop the tank was actually used to keep grenades from being thrown in, which had been theorized as a main weakness by designers, but proved to later be unnecessary as the probability was extremely small. The awkward netting was removed from future tank designs after WWI.

comment.author: 40708286@N07
comment._content: It is a Tank not an armoured car, the official photograph has the description wrong. It is a British Mk1 Tank

comment.author: 51039755@N05
comment._content: 705, "Clan Leslie" moving up Chimpanzee Valley on 14th September 1916. On the 15th it would break down and thus fail to participate in the first ever tank attack. It is also shown in other photographs and was filmed: www.flickr.com/photos/nlscotland/4699756129/in/photostream/ www.flickr.com/photos/nlscotland/4699761269/in/photostream/ www.flickr.com/photos/nlscotland/4700388844/in/photostream/ www.flickr.com/photos/nlscotland/4699756869/in/photostream/ Source: sites.google.com/site/landships/home/lists/listofmkimalet...
